macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Close Higher Amid Tech and China Stock Gains
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 0.6%, S&P 500 gained 0.55%, and Nasdaq Composite increased 0.9%. Netflix fell 2%, Micron rose 2%, Novo Nordisk surged nearly 5%, while Nasdaq China Golden Dragon Index rose 1.6% with Alibaba up 5% and JD.com up 3.2%.

items.title: Hong Kong and China Stocks End Slightly Up After Volatile Session
items.summary: Hang Seng Index closed up 0.17% at 26,629.96, Hang Seng TECH up 0.28% at 5,762.44. China's Shanghai Composite gained 0.14%, Shenzhen Component up 0.5%, ChiNext up 1.01%, led by oil & gas and aerospace sectors.

items.title: S&P 500 Technicals Show Bullish Signals Despite Overbought Warnings
items.summary: Equity put-call ratios rolled over to buy signals after January 21 trading, market breadth oscillators remain positive, NYSE new highs dominate, and VIX trend supports stocks. Caution advised if S&P retreats to 6,700.

items.title: Magnificent Seven Stocks Stall in 2026, Rotation to Broader Market Underway
items.summary: Magnificent Seven tech leaders in the red for 2026 as momentum stalls, potentially signaling shift to new winners. Eli Lilly partners with Nvidia on drug discovery amid GLP-1 obesity pill hype.

items.title: S&P 500 Valuations Reach Dot-Com Era Levels, Crash Risks Highlighted
items.summary: S&P 500 up 77% in three years on AI hype, with price-to-sales ratio near 41—highest since early 2000s dot-com peak. Concerns rise over potential 2026 crash amid heavy AI investments without payoffs.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Pulls Back from $98K Peak Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Bitcoin experienced a sharp pullback from near $97,924, retreating to around $87,000 before recovering modestly. The decline was triggered by macro shocks including geopolitical tensions and Japanese government bond yield spikes, with the 10-year JGB yield reaching 2.34%.

items.title: Strategy Acquires $2.13B in Bitcoin in Major Weekly Purchase
items.summary: Strategy acquired 22,305 bitcoin between January 12-19 for approximately $2.13 billion, marking one of the firm's largest weekly runs since November 2024.

items.title: NYSE Announces Tokenized Stocks and ETFs Platform
items.summary: The New York Stock Exchange announced plans to create a platform for tokenized US stocks and ETFs featuring 24/7 trading, fractional shares, and near-instant settlement, pending regulatory approval.

items.title: Ethereum Hits Record 2.9M Daily Transactions Despite Fee Stability
items.summary: Ethereum activity surged in January, breaking a record of 2.9 million daily transactions on Friday, with transaction fees remaining near recent lows due to layer-2 rollups and protocol upgrades.

items.title: CLARITY Act Delayed as Coinbase Withdraws Support
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee announced a multi-week pause on the CLARITY Act, a long-awaited crypto market structure bill, after Coinbase withdrew support over unresolved disagreements regarding stablecoin yield and other issues.

items.title: Crypto Markets Show Resilience Despite Macro Shocks
items.summary: Despite Bitcoin falling to $87,000 and Ethereum to $2,800, crypto derivatives markets remained orderly with significantly lower leverage than October 2025 peaks, preventing cascading liquidations.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: HAGD Achieves 91% Sparse Circuit Extraction from Billion-Parameter Language Models
items.summary: Researchers introduced Hierarchical Attribution Graph Decomposition (HAGD), a framework that extracts sparse computational circuits from LLMs up to 70 billion parameters with 91% behavioral preservation on tasks. It reduces complexity for mechanistic interpretability and shows shared patterns across models like GPT-2, Llama, and Pythia.

items.title: Keysight Launches Machine Learning Toolkit for Faster PDK Development
items.summary: Keysight Technologies released a new Machine Learning Toolkit to accelerate device modeling and Process Design Kit (PDK) development in semiconductor design.

items.title: Harvested Reservoir Computing: AI Framework Turns City Traffic into Energy-Efficient Computer
items.summary: A novel AI approach called Harvested Reservoir Computing uses natural traffic flow dynamics for energy-efficient computing in urban environments.

items.title: Embedded Computing Roundup Highlights AI Trends from CES 2026
items.summary: Weekly news roundup covers AI-enhanced workflows in Emerson's NI PXI test platform, BIOSTAR's edge computing, and CES 2026 trends like AI and sensor fusion.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Unveils Details of Major Restructuring Plan
items.summary: Ubisoft announced a significant corporate restructure aimed at becoming more 'gamer-centric,' involving reorganization around five creative houses, cost-cutting measures, project cancellations, and stricter return-to-office mandates. The restructuring includes the cancellation of six games, including a Prince of Persia: Sands of Time remake.

items.title: Payday Developer Starbreeze Announces New Wave of Layoffs
items.summary: Starbreeze Studios, developer of the Payday franchise, is proceeding with additional layoffs as part of ongoing restructuring efforts.

items.title: Moonshot Games Confirms Layoffs
items.summary: Moonshot Games, developer of Wildgate, has announced layoffs affecting the studio.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct 2026 Showcases Major Titles
items.summary: Microsoft's Xbox Developer Direct livestream featured gameplay reveals for Forza Horizon 6, Fable, and Game Freak's Beast of Reincarnation, with a mystery fourth game also announced.

items.title: Game Freak's Beast of Reincarnation Gameplay Revealed
items.summary: Game Freak unveiled the first major gameplay look at Beast of Reincarnation, featuring a young woman tasked with cleansing a growing darkness.

items.title: Belfast XR Festival Launches £200,000 Fund for Emerging Developers
items.summary: The Belfast XR Festival announced a new £200,000 fund to support emerging XR (extended reality) developers.

items.title: 1SP Agency Acquires Game Event Networking Platform MeetToMatch
items.summary: 1SP Agency has acquired MeetToMatch, a game event networking platform designed to facilitate industry connections.

items.title: Defeating Games for Charity Returns for Third Annual Marathon
items.summary: The Defeating Games for Charity video game marathon returns this weekend (January 23-25, 2026) on Twitch to raise funds for the Video Game History Foundation.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: US and China Sign Off on TikTok Deal
items.summary: The U.S. and Chinese governments have approved a deal transferring control of TikTok's U.S. operations to a joint venture led by Oracle and Silver Lake, resolving concerns about ByteDance's ownership.

items.title: Major Tech Companies Announce 165,000+ Job Cuts in 2026
items.summary: Amazon, Intel, Microsoft, and 17 other tech giants are cutting over 165,000 roles combined, with Intel eliminating approximately 24,000 positions and Microsoft reducing workforce by 15,000 or more as part of restructuring efforts.

items.title: HCL Technologies Expands US Public Sector Presence
items.summary: HCL Technologies announced a strategic partnership with Carahsoft to strengthen its footprint in the US public sector market, offering cloud, cybersecurity, and digital engineering services to federal, state, and local agencies.

items.title: TCS Partners with Kalmar for IT Transformation
items.summary: Tata Consultancy Services entered into a partnership with Kalmar to consolidate fragmented IT systems into an AI-enabled digital core, managing services for over 5,200 employees across various regions.

items.title: Ethernovia Raises $90 Million for Ethernet-Based Chip Technology
items.summary: Ethernovia secured $90 million in funding to develop Ethernet-based chips designed for low-latency data movement in vehicles, industrial machines, and sensor-heavy robotics systems.
